item.title: Super Mario Strikers Is the Switch 2's First Post-Launch GameCube Game
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has revealed the first post-launch GameCube game coming to the Switch 2 as part of the Nintendo Switch Online service, and it's none other than arcade sports classic Super Mario Strikers.

As revealed in a new trailer, Super Mario Strikers will be joining the console's GameCube lineup on July 3rd, taking its place alongside games like The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker and SoulCalibur II.

Just like with other GameCube games, as well as titles available on systems like the Game Boy Advance and the Sega Genesis, you're going to need an Expansion Pack addon if you want to enjoy Super Mario Strikers.

If you're unfamiliar with Super Mario Strikers, it's a soccer (or football, if you're from the same sceptred isle as me) game that stars characters from the Mario franchise. Playables include Mario himself, of course, as well as Donkey Kong, Waluigi, and more.

Originally released in 2005, Super Mario Strikers was developed by Next Level Games, who, at that point, were known only for 2003 sports title NHL Hitz Pro. The studio would go on to work alongside Nintendo on games like the Wii's Punch-Out!! remake, as well as the two Luigi's Mansion sequels.

Naturally, Super Mario Strikers puts a characteristically Nintendo spin on soccer; while the basic rules remain largely intact, you can use Mario-themed items to gain an advantage, and characters also have access to special attacks to turn the tide of play.

Super Mario Strikers serves as the first in a series of three games; the first followup, 2007's Mario Strikers Charged, was released for the Wii, but it would take another fifteen years before Mario Strikers: Battle League would appear on the Switch, once again developed by Next Level Games.

You can check out Super Mario Strikers as part of the Nintendo Switch Online GameCube lineup when it takes to the pitch on July 3rd. Again, though, you'll need a Switch Online Expansion Pack addon to enjoy it.
